content: The module presents a top-down view of cloud computing, from applications and administration to programming and infrastructure. The main focus of the module is on parallel programming techniques for cloud computing and the large-scale distributed systems that make up the cloud computing infrastructure. Contents include: overview of cloud computing, cloud computing systems, virtualization technology, security in the cloud, and application development in the cloud. COURSE SYLLABUS
(Promulgated together with the decision No. QD/ĐHKTTQD, 2024)
1. GENERAL INFORMATION
Title: Cloud Computing
Course number: CNTT1167E
Type of course: In-depth knowledge
Number of credits: 3 
Theory hours: 30
Discuss/Practice hours: 15
Self-study hours: 90
Prerequisite courses: CNTT1128; CNTT1116; CNTT1114
2. DEPARTMENT AND TEACHER 
Faculty: Department of Information Technology 
Address: Room 1310 (Building A1) - NEU, 207 Giai Phong - Hai Ba Trưng district- HN.
Lecturer:
3. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
The module presents a top-down view of cloud computing, from applications and administration to programming and infrastructure. The main focus of the module is on parallel programming techniques for cloud computing and the large-scale distributed systems that make up the cloud computing infrastructure. Contents include: overview of cloud computing, cloud computing systems, virtualization technology, security in the cloud, and application development in the cloud. Students will study modern solutions for cloud computing developed by Google, Amazon, Microsoft, VMWare, etc.
The course also aims to train thinking ability, computing skills and improve the ability to apply algorithms to analyze and research problems in the field of cloud computing. The course equips learners with the necessary knowledge, skills and competencies to search, retrieve and exploit subject-related resources and continue to higher education.
4. LEARNING RESOURCES
Course books:
[1] Huỳnh Quyết Thắng (2014) Điện toán đám mây, Nhà xuất bản Trường Đại Học Bách Khoa Hà Nội.
Reference books: 
[2] Hwang, Kai, Jack Dongarra, and Geoffrey C. Fox. Distributed and cloud computing: from parallel processing to the internet of things. Morgan Kaufmann, 2013
[3] Rountree, Derrick, and Ileana Castrillo. The Basics of Cloud Computing: Understanding the Fundamentals of Cloud Computing in Theory and Practice. Newnes, 2013

9. CLASS REGULATION
9.1. Requirements for taking final/terminal exams 
Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exam (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (scale of 10).
9.2. Requirements for attending classes
Students/students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure, there must be sufficient and reasonable proofs. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted from the process assessment. Students who miss more than 3 classes, with or without reason, will be considered as not completing the course and must re-register.
Students will be added points for each construction speech, which can be compensated for attendance points and test scores.
9.3. Requirements for in-class behavior
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and teachers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to school on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class.
Absolutely do not make noise, affecting others during the learning process.
Absolutely do not eat, chew gum, use devices such as phones, music players during class time.
Notebooks and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking lecture notes, calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely not for other purposes.
